title: As a top laner, getting ganked 3 minutes in every game is getting pretty tedious.
body: Would be nice for Junglers to have less impact/presence early game.

replies.body:
> 2:50- drop ward

> 3:10- Enemy jungler shows up

> 3:11- Walk away making it painfully obvious to the enemy jungler that you see them

> 3:15- enemy jungler leaves

It's legit that easy
Or, if you are a real dick, walk back and forth making them waste time thinking you are going to over extend
lol i love doing that
Wasting the enemy jungler's time is a real tactic.
My favourite is when they run through the lane bush, but they fuck up so you see them for a brief second. Then you start doing that.

Except the part where you can't ward because you're engaged on by your lane opponent and then while trying to kill them, you get ganked.

Or the time where you can't ward because they're ganking.

So learn from your mistakes.

You know Junglers are finishing their clears around the 3 minute mark, and very often will look top lane for a gank. Dont force a fight that wont be over before then, and play like you actually have some forethought instead of mindlessly diving onto your enemy.

And why isn't your jungler ever coming?

And given most top laners are immobile, what usually happens is this:

You see the enemy jungler pop up (except zac, eve, or maybe shaco). As you do, you try to run away, but the enemy laner engages on you. You have no mobility and are forced to burn flash.

Or, you're engaging in a fight, while the brush is warded, and then the enemy jungler just happens to come along. Solution to this could be "just don't fight." Yeah? And waste all your early laning power? Run away whenever the enemy engages on you? No, if you ever get into that situation, your jungler isn't doing enough to your lane, or the other lanes.

OR the enemy jungler comes through the unwarded bush. You have either 0-1 wards depending on whether or not you warded red buff at the jungler's request. The enemy, usually a mobile one, sneaks in from your allied jungle and just kills you when the lane is frozen in the middle. You can only ward one bush; the jungler just comes in from the other one.

All of your imagined situations are entirely pointless.

You know the junglers finish their camps at roughly 3 minutes.

Play safe from 3:00-4:00.

Its as simple as that. If the enemy makes an aggressive play against you, back the fuck off, because clearly the jungler is waiting to join in the fight. 

Also, VERY few top laners right now have no form of escape at all. All of the very immobile ones have already been pushed out of the lane.


IF You choose to use your early laning power aggressively instead, do so properly warded (Very few junglers can afford to gank from the long way top lane at lvl 3, not even Zac), or you accept the fact the enemy jungler is going to punish you because of how the timing works out.

Play safe and waste your power spike? Many champs have power spikes around that time, if the enemy jungler can come to punish you for your power spike, your jungler should be able to punish them for that too.

>Its as simple as that. If the enemy makes an aggressive play against you, back the fuck off, because clearly the jungler is waiting to join in the fight.

Clearly not, because as I engage, my jungler is still in his jungle farming. So when I make an aggressive play at 3:00 to 4:00, their jungler comes, but when THEY make an aggressive play, I have to back off and my jungler doesn't need to do anything? 

It needs to be both ways. If only the enemy jungler is coming to top, your jungler needs to be doing something other than farming. Gank mid, Gank bot, Gank top. Pick one. If you're farming, you're doing something wrong unless you're exclusively a farming jungler.

> Also, VERY few top laners right now have no form of escape at all. All of the very immobile ones have already been pushed out of the lane.

Uhhh, no, most junglers are still more immobile than the junglers. The time period when top laners were mobile has long singe paseed (tank fizz tank ekko)

You and I are clearly arguing different things.

My entire comment chain is directed at how to deal with the situation yourself. 

You are directing it at how your own jungler should be dealing with the situation. Unfortunately, you don't get to control that. So you work with what you have. If you want to make plays at a time where the enemy jungler is likely going to be visiting, and you have clear knowledge of where your jungler is, whose fault is that really? 

Of course im not going to disagree your jungler should be doing something in response (youll see a lot of jungle games in my match history if you look), but thats irrelevant to the top.

For your last comment, im gonna assume you meant most top laners. Some of the most popular top lane champions right now have built in escapes, or are very tanky, so your comment, while true, is really irrelevant. I didnt say they were highly mobile. I said that they have forms of escape.

For top lane:

You hit lvl 3 before the opponent does. This is a huge power spike for most laners. If you don't take advantage of the power gap, you might not win lane. You go in, and the enemy jungler comes. Not much you can do about that situation.

If you just play safe and play the waiting game, you essentially give up the lane. This works if you're a tank, because that's what you're used to doing, but not for many other champs. Most top laners have some escape, but they won't get away unscratched usually.

You could die, you could lose summs, or you can be forced to recall. Jungler should not able to do that or force you to playing safe that early on, when they haven't even shown up yet.

>Jungler should not able to do that or force you to playing safe that early on

Except that is literally exactly what the jungler is supposed to do.
Not without actually showing their faces in lane.
You can always watch for where they dropped the ward and go around it.

3.15- They go farm scuttle or whatever other topside camp

3.50 Ward expires 

4.00- You go to ward the bush again 

4.05- Surprise motherfucker,here he is yet again

Happens to me way too often lmao
ganking over and over does lose junglers EXP (assuming you dont die)
and then they get more xp per camp because of catch up xp which is why theres a gank heavy meta.?

> [{quoted}](name=AwesomeGuyDj,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M53JApJX,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2017-06-09T01:24:11.509+0000)
>
> and then they get more xp per camp because of catch up xp which is why theres a gank heavy meta.?

here's this sick nasty new concept to help you counter this

**invade the jungle and steal his shit so he doesnt catch up crippling him in the long run**

If you farm the jungle, and invade, you aren't offering map presence.

Right now, the meat is whoever has the most presence, wins.

Ganking constantly will eventually put you behind, but not before whichever lane you ganked gets way too far ahead for the enemy laner to ever come back from. 

Games these days are practically decided from the 10-15 minute mark; the "long run" isn't really as existant anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=VulDread,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M53JApJX,comment-id=0008000000000001,timestamp=2017-06-09T05:04:58.576+0000)
>
> If you farm the jungle, and invade, you aren't offering map presence.
> 
> Right now, the meat is whoever has the most presence, wins.
> 
> Ganking constantly will eventually put you behind, but not before whichever lane you ganked gets way too far ahead for the enemy laner to ever come back from. 
> 
> Games these days are practically decided from the 10-15 minute mark; the "long run" isn't really as existant anymore.

thats if you dont play it correctly

invade, ward, counter gank, hell you could probably straight up kill the enemy jungler with the level advantage,

Most of the junglers that are farming or ganking don't have the power to countergank or kill them, because most of the ganking junglers are early-game powerhouses.

The farmers tend to be more late-game based.

Yi, for instance is a common one in low elo. Eventually there will be a point where he can kill that Lee Sin and Elise.

But he won't be able to countergank them for a long time. 

You can invade them, and they'll be ganking while you do.

It's a race between the jungler being fed off the jgl mobs (which have had their xp nerfed, so AFK farming isn't as efficient) and the laners getting ahead.

League being a team game means that 2-4 people getting fed and snowballing is usually more effective than one jungler holding all the gold.
A lane you gank only gets far ahead if the gank is successful.  Don't let the enemy gank be successful and the jungler will fall behind.
That's not really up to you as a jungler. You can countergank, but, assuming you aren't one of the "gank only" champ, and they are, you're much weaker, so it's a wasted effort.

Yeah, you have to rely on your team.  It's a team game.  That's how it works.

As a jungler you respond by counterjungling.  Also by warding their jungle so your laners can be prepared for the ganks.

So I don't get this "don't blame the jgler schtick"
The jgler is one of the influential members of the team.

Call them out for doing nothing.

Dude you are flying in at so many different angles you gotta sit down and actually say your stance and stop forcing people to play guesswork.

And it's not the jungler's fault someone got caught out by a gank.

Fuck dude, I even said what the fuck a jungler can do in response to the other guy ganking.  You are just wildly complaining without even reading.

>If you farm the jungle, and invade, you aren't offering map presence.

>Right now, the meat is whoever has the most presence, wins.

>Ganking constantly will eventually put you behind, but not before whichever lane you ganked gets way too far ahead for the enemy laner to ever come back from. 

>Games these days are practically decided from the 10-15 minute mark; the "long run" isn't really as existant anymore.

This is my stance. My bad, the other one is from the other argument.

The jungler can make the enemy laner get caught out. It's not their fault someone got caught out, but they need to do something. 

I already told you why the other things don't work;

AFK Farming and counterjungling doesn't work for the long run, which isn't there anymore.

Invading doesn't work because they're constantly ganking

Counterganking only works if you are also a ganking based jungler

>The jungler can make the enemy laner get caught out.

They literally cannot.

> which isn't there anymore.

There isn't because players have yet to learn how to deal with aggression.

>Invading doesn't work because they're constantly ganking

Yes it does.  If the gank is unsuccessful they are going to be way behind.

>Counterganking only works if you are also a ganking based jungler

This makes 0 sense.  You don't need to be able to kill the other jungler if they are in a lane trying to gank it.

> They literally cannot.

If you're playing vs something like Mundo, Olaf, or Nunu, you have a lot of breathing room for overextending. Zac or Lee Sin automatically means you have to respect their powers and play much more safe. Turrets being weak and diving being easy doesn't help with this, either. So, with certain junglers and certain matchups, whenever you try to get cs, it's "overextending." Panth+Zac, for instance. You try to get CS, you get W'd by Panth while Zac jumps from whichever area you didn't ward. You were behind the "halfway point" at Top lane, but you're still "overextended."

>There isn't because players have yet to learn how to deal with aggression.

But the higher the elo, the shorter the games.

Does that mean the higher the elo you are, the less the players know how to deal with aggression?

> Yes it does. If the gank is unsuccessful they are going to be way behind.


IF the gank is unsuccessful. 

> This makes 0 sense. You don't need to be able to kill the other jungler if they are in a lane trying to gank it.

You're playing Yi, the enemy jungler is playing Zac, Zac and the enemy laner engage on your top laner. You can come as Yi, you just won't do much in the fight before it's all done.

As the game drags on, you'll have more impact, but not in the ganking phase.

You don't need to be able to kill the enemy jungler, but you need to be able to contest it. And most champs that aren't one of the ganking-based junglers can't compete with the ganking-based junglers.

#That's not making the enemy laner get caught out.  That is the enemy laner not warding and not respecting the power of the jungler.  Fuck you are describing one team playing better than the other team.  That is something we should encourage and celebrate, not beg for nerfs.


Also yeah, high elo players are garbage at managing aggression.  You can see this in tournaments.

It's in the power of the enemy laner to decide how successful a gank is.

And now you are strawmanning scenarios that prove your argument right.  There is no such thing as a ganking phase.  Ganking is an action that players do throughout the lifetime of a match.  Ganking is only as good as the lanes being ganked are outplayed.  If the ganker and his comrades are better, then they will get kills.  If not then they won't.

You made up a phase that doesn't exist in a game where the "phases" are debatable.  There is no "helping" there is you learning how to communicate.

It is being outplayed.  You know their jungler from the start of the game.  You know what their jungler can do.  The jungler doesn't randomly spawn in locations where they can gank you from.  The jungler doesn't randomly show up if you are pushed out too far w/o wards.  The jungler isn't a random number the game calculates.  It's a person running a route that can be predicted and even known through proper ward usage.

If you got ganked and killed that was your own fault.  Deal with it.  Git gud. Stop whining.
Just about to say, XP catchup is super dumb right now.

Expect it? I play tanks top almost exclusively so I understand what you're saying, but my off role is jungle and I love hitting top lane first because they never ward, they always try to push to hit level 2 or 3 first, and I always catch a flash or a first blood.
If you get ganked on 3 minutes exactly every game I suggest you ward @ 2:50 and play passive till 4 .
